column4: i'm sure this isn't kosher, but i'd be willing to paypal someone 10$CDN if they can fix my problem.. https://answers.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+question/48507
http://www.gnu.org/philosophy/motivation.html

interesting article, but i think my problem falls under: The basic principles of reinforcement and rewards certainly work, but in a restricted context” — restricted, that is, to tasks that are not especially interesting.
you're probably approaching the wrong crowd here, though. All of the helpers here who I know are doing it for the love of it.
yeah i realize
but so far i'm not having much luck, unfortunately
I'm having no luck at all retrieving your link (launchpad hasn't been inaccessible for me all day)
hasn't been accessible or inaccessible?
not accessible, sorry
well there really isn't that much more info there
depending on where those errors are displayed, you may be able to halt the scrolling with the Pause key
it's not perhaps a timing problem with your partitions becoming available only after a critical point during booting? Just speculating
check out the errors around lines 400-500
seen them, looks worrying, but I can't claim any ability to make sense of it all
=/ the boot halts at around line 582
occasionally, there are conflicts between SATA and PATA. I've seen this on an MSI mainboard, but it's been reported on launchpad for other hardware
interesting...
can i tell the installer to use one over the other? lsmod tells me i have a bunch of pata and satas loaded
I don't think so -- I'd try to solve this kind of problem on the hardware front.
I'm leaving now. Hope you can fix it.
thanks for you help =)
and yea, me too
good luck. Bye
